sentences.en: And it was no longer the same cramped, awkward handwriting as before.
sentences.cn: 他的笔迹,也不像先前那样扭曲拙笨.

sentences.en: But then he would see the cramped hand.
sentences.cn: 不过这一来它会看到这只抽筋的手了.

sentences.en: He cooked for himself in the cramped kitchen.
sentences.cn: 他在狭窄的小厨房里为自己做饭烧菜.

sentences.en: He is cooped up in a cramped cell with 10 other inmates.
sentences.cn: 他和其他10名犯人被囚禁在一间狭窄的牢房里。

sentences.en: His left hand was still cramped, but he was unknotting It'slowly.
sentences.cn: 他的左手依然在抽筋, 但他正在慢慢地把它张开.

sentences.en: I walked up and down the aisle to stretch my cramped muscles.
sentences.cn: 我在楼道里走来走去以舒展我痉挛的肌肉.

sentences.en: In later years he lived in a rather cramped little flat in Bristol.
sentences.cn: 他晚年住在布里斯托尔一间相当狭小的公寓内。

sentences.en: It is unworthy of it to be cramped.
Lack of money cramped our efforts.
sentences.cn: 资金紧缺限制了我们的努力.

sentences.en: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
sentences.cn: 她将能伸展一下蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

sentences.en: The house was terribly small and cramped, but the agent described it as a bijou residence.
sentences.cn: 房子十分狭小拥挤，但经纪人却把它说成是小巧别致的住宅。

sentences.en: The kitchen was small and cramped.
The troops slept in cramped conditions with up to 20 in a single room.
sentences.cn: 士兵们睡在拥挤的环境里，一个房间多达20人。

sentences.en: The writing on the back of the card was cramped but scrupulously neat.
sentences.cn: 这张卡片的背面写满了密密麻麻但却十分工整的字。

sentences.en: There are hundreds of families living in cramped conditions on the floor of the airport lounge.
sentences.cn: 数百个家庭住在机场候机室拥挤的地板上。

words.tran_cn: 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的
痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳
束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧
用夹钳夹；约束（cramp的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a cramped room, building etc does not have enough space for the people in it

trans.tran_cn: 夹紧(cramp的过去式)，用夹钳夹，约束
